Name: Monumental Ruins
Description: The builders of this place worked with great slabs of Neath-wall stone, carved with blank-eyed, unsmiling faces and blocky, stoic serpents.

DefaultEvent.Name: Wine and sea-bread
DefaultEvent.Description: You and your comrades find stones to perch on, and munch laverbread, truffles and herring. Someone passes a bottle of Greyfields: an adequate vintage. White crickets buzz in the weeds. A shiver of wind passes, and then the air is still, with that absence of chill that passes for warmth down here. Two zailors compare tattoos. Your head swims pleasantly with the wine.

ChildBranches.Name: Picnic
ChildBranches.Description: Creepers climb the shattered pyramid. An owl blinks at you from an idol's mouth. In the undergrowth, a cave-lizard munches decorously on a white cricket. This place seems peaceful. Rest a while.
Don't forget Anarchist camp option - but tie to larger arc.

DefaultEvent.Name: Only shadows
DefaultEvent.Description: This place was deserted long ago. You find traces of gilt on a shattered altar; remnants of vermilion paint on a rotting ritual mask. Nothing else.

ChildBranches.Name: Search warily
ChildBranches.Description: The Neath is rarely gentle. Treat this place as enemy territory.
